intro: Raoulia australis var. albosericea, commonly known as the white silky raoulia, is a variant of the raoulia plant native to southern regions of Australia. It is characterized by its soft, silvery-white foliage, which gives it a distinctive and ornamental appearance. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with small, narrow leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. This variety is well-suited to dry, sunny conditions and is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in coastal gardens.
